children.para: Improvedaccesstocriticalinfrastructureandservicesfortheruralpoor . Ruralvillagesexperiencehighlevelsofpoverty,havelimitedaccesstoqualityservicesandinfrastructure,and havehadlittlevoiceinthedevelopmentprocess.Increasedinvestmentsincriticalinfrastructurethatcan improveaccesstomarketsandkeyservicescansignificantlyalterthedevelopmentpathbyempoweringrural communitiestoincreasetheirproductionandincome.TheWBGwillscaleupthenationalcommunity?driven developmentprogramtoincreaseaccesstobasicservicesforruralcommunities,includinginconflict?affected areas.Theprogramhelpsincreaseaccesstoanduseofbasicinfrastructureandservices(e.g.,smallfeederroads, foot?paths and bridges, drinking water systems, rehabilitation of schools and health Centers) through a participatoryapproach,whilecreatingaplatformforGovernmenttodeliverinfrastructureimprovements throughabottomup,participatoryapproach.ThescaleupoftheCDDprojectisscheduledtorunthrough January2021,withindicatorsbelowreflectingonlytargetstobereachedduringtheCPFperiod.. Populationintownshipsbenefiting fromimprovedaccesstoanduseof ruralinfrastructureandservicesunder theWBGinterventions(number) Baseline:0.8million(2014) Target:3.3million(2017);ofwhichat least40percentfemale

children.name: Public Service Delivery
children.para: c("Improved\xa0access\xa0to\xa0critical\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0Servicesfor\xa0the\xa0rural\xa0poor\xa0 . Rural\xa0villages\xa0experience\xa0high\xa0levels\xa0of\xa0poverty,\xa0have\xa0limited\xa0access\xa0to\xa0quality\xa0Services\xa0and\xa0infrastructure,\xa0and\xa0 have\xa0had\xa0little\xa0voice\xa0in\xa0the\xa0development\xa0process.\xa0Increased\xa0investments\xa0in\xa0critical\xa0infrastructure\xa0that\xa0can\xa0 improve\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets\xa0and\xa0key\xa0Services\xa0can\xa0significantly\xa0alter\xa0the\xa0development\xa0path\xa0by\xa0empowering\xa0rural\xa0 communities\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0their\xa0production\xa0and\xa0income.\xa0\xa0The\xa0WBG\xa0will\xa0scale\xa0up\xa0the\xa0national\xa0community?driven\xa0 development\xa0program\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0basic\xa0Services\xa0for\xa0rural\xa0communities,\xa0including\xa0in\xa0conflict?affected\xa0 areas.\xa0The\xa0program\xa0helps\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0and\xa0use\xa0of\xa0basic\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0Services\xa0(e.g.,\xa0small\xa0feeder\xa0roads,\xa0 foot?paths\xa0 and\xa0 bridges,\xa0 drinking\xa0 water\xa0 systems,\xa0 rehabilitation\xa0 of\xa0 schools\xa0 and\xa0 health\xa0 centers)\xa0 through\xa0 a\xa0 participatory\xa0approach,\xa0while\xa0creating\xa0a\xa0platform\xa0for\xa0government\xa0to\xa0deliver\xa0infrastructure\xa0improvements\xa0 through\xa0a\xa0bottom\xa0up,\xa0participatory\xa0approach.\xa0\xa0The\xa0scale\xa0up\xa0of\xa0the\xa0CDD\xa0project\xa0is\xa0scheduled\xa0to\xa0run\xa0through\xa0 January\xa02021,\xa0with\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0only\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0CPF\xa0period.\xa0\xa0. need\xa0to\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0regional\xa0and\xa0global\xa0production/value\xa0chain\xa0networks.\xa0\xa0Transaction\xa0costs\xa0for\xa0international\xa0 Trade\xa0can\xa0be\xa0reduced\xa0through\xa0reforms\xa0of\xa0institutions,\xa0policies,\xa0and\xa0procedures,\xa0and\xa0through\xa0applying\xa0Conflict\xa0 and\xa0gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 Given\xa0its\xa0long\xa0period\xa0of\xa0international\xa0isolation,\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0Myanmar\xa0will\xa0 need\xa0to\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0regional\xa0and\xa0global\xa0production/value\xa0chain\xa0networks.\xa0\xa0Transaction\xa0costs\xa0for\xa0international\xa0 trade\xa0can\xa0be\xa0reduced\xa0through\xa0reforms\xa0of\xa0institutions,\xa0policies,\xa0and\xa0procedures,\xa0and\xa0through\xa0applying\xa0conflict\xa0 and\xa0Gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 discourage\xa0the\xa0growth\xa0of\xa0overseas\xa0trade.\xa0A\xa0Diagnostic\xa0of\xa0Trade\xa0Integration\xa0Study\xa0(DTIS)\xa0will\xa0be\xa0carried\xa0out\xa0to\xa0 identify\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0improving\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0capacities\xa0to\xa0benefit\xa0from\xa0trade.\xa0Technical\xa0work\xa0following\xa0on\xa0 the\xa0DTIS\xa0could\xa0include\xa0additional\xa0knowledge\xa0work\xa0on\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0transport\xa0facilitation\xa0assessments,\xa0customs\xa0 modernization,\xa0 and\xa0 sector\xa0 specific\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa01\xa0(2017\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa01\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 21.\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0recommended\xa0 laws/regulations/amendments/codes\xa0 enacted\xa0or\xa0government\xa0policies\xa0 adopted\xa0\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n" )

discourage\xa0the\xa0growth\xa0of\xa0overseas\xa0Trade.\xa0A\xa0Diagnostic\xa0of\xa0Trade\xa0Integration\xa0Study\xa0(DTIS)\xa0will\xa0be\xa0carried\xa0out\xa0to\xa0 identify\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0improving\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0capacities\xa0to\xa0benefit\xa0from\xa0Trade.\xa0Technical\xa0work\xa0following\xa0on\xa0 the\xa0DTIS\xa0could\xa0include\xa0additional\xa0knowledge\xa0work\xa0on\xa0Trade\xa0and\xa0transport\xa0facilitation\xa0assessments,\xa0customs\xa0 modernization,\xa0 and\xa0 sector\xa0 specific\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0Trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 children.para: c("\xa0Increased\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0farming\xa0and\xa0agribusiness\xa0 \xa0 . Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 due\xa0to\xa0poor\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0compounded\xa0by\xa0an\xa0over?dependence\xa0on\xa0rice.\xa0Low\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0turn\xa0are\xa0a\xa0result\xa0of\xa0a\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0 access\xa0by\xa0farming\xa0households\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0agricultural\xa0assets,\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services.\xa0More\xa0productive\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 aims\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0order\xa0to\xa0have\xa0a\xa0positive\xa0effect\xa0on\xa0agricultural\xa0incomes.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0 Bank\xa0expects\xa0to\xa0support\xa0an\xa0integrated\xa0program\xa0that\xa0combines\xa0improvements\xa0in\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0drainage,\xa0 extension\xa0services,\xa0and\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0upgrades\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0crop\xa0yields\xa0and\xa0develop\xa0a\xa0competitive\xa0rural\xa0sector\xa0that\xa0 offers\xa0opportunities\xa0to\xa0all\xa0rural\xa0households.\xa0\xa0Alongside\xa0analytical\xa0work,\xa0these\xa0initial\xa0engagements\xa0will\xa0pilot\xa0new\xa0 approaches,\xa0inform\xa0the\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0and\xa0serve\xa0a\xa0demonstration\xa0effect\xa0to\xa0facilitate\xa0reform\xa0across\xa0the\xa0sector.\xa0\xa0 The\xa0 World\xa0 Bank\xa0 will\xa0 also\xa0 support\xa0 further\xa0 agricultural\xa0 productivity\xa0 enhancements\xa0 by\xa0 providing\xa0 agrometeorological\xa0 services,\xa0 facilitating\xa0 inland\xa0 water\xa0 transport\xa0 for\xa0 agricultural\xa0 outputs\xa0 and\xa0 enhancing\xa0 the\xa0 government\x92s\xa0capacity\xa0to\xa0manage\xa0and\xa0deliver\xa0water\xa0resources\xa0to\xa0farmers. . people.\xa0Only\xa030\xa0percent\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0adult\xa0population\xa0has\xa0access\xa0to\xa0financial\xa0services\xa0provided\xa0either\xa0by\xa0 commercial\xa0banks\xa0or\xa0microfinance\xa0institutions.\xa0The\xa0WBG\xa0aims\xa0to\xa0support\xa0the\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0the\xa0country\x92s\xa0 Roadmap\xa0 for\xa0 Financial\xa0 Inclusion\xa0 by\xa0 modernizing\xa0 payment\xa0 systems,\xa0 strengthening\xa0 financial\xa0 sector\xa0 intermediaries,\xa0fostering\xa0new\xa0financial\xa0products,\xa0and\xa0building\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0financial\xa0sector\xa0regulators\xa0and\xa0 supervisors.\xa0WBG\xa0interventions\xa0in\xa0the\xa0area\xa0of\xa0financial\xa0inclusion\xa0would\xa0be\xa0structured\xa0in\xa0a\xa0comprehensive\xa0 program\xa0that\xa0is\xa0joint\xa0between\xa0WB,\xa0IFC\xa0and\xa0interested\xa0bilateral\xa0donors\xa0around\xa0four\xa0areas:\xa0(i)\xa0modernizing\xa0 payment\xa0systems\xa0and\xa0financial\xa0sector\xa0infrastructure,\xa0(ii)\xa0strengthening\xa0private\xa0financial\xa0institutions\xa0critical\xa0for\xa0 financial\xa0inclusion\xa0(microfinance\xa0institutions,\xa0private\xa0banks)\xa0and\xa0transforming\xa0select\xa0State?owned\xa0banks\xa0into\xa0 financially\xa0sustainable\xa0institutions,\xa0(iii)\xa0expanding\xa0financial\xa0instruments\xa0and\xa0products\xa0(SME\xa0lending,\xa0agriculture\xa0lending,\xa0insurance,\xa0digital\xa0finance,\xa0etc.);\xa0and\xa0(iv)\xa0strengthening\xa0the\xa0capability\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Central\xa0Bank\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\xa0 and\xa0Ministry\xa0of\xa0Finance\xa0to\xa0monitor\xa0the\xa0soundness\xa0and\xa0integrity\xa0of\xa0the\xa0financial\xa0system.\xa0 . 16.\xa0Additional\xa0people,\xa0 microenterprises\xa0and\xa0SMEs\xa0 reached\xa0with\xa0financial\xa0services\xa0\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target\xa0(2017):\xa0200,000\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 "\xa0Improved\xa0capacity\xa0to\xa0facilitate\xa0(and\xa0benefit\xa0from)\xa0trade. Given\xa0its\xa0long\xa0period\xa0of\xa0international\xa0isolation,\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0Myanmar\xa0will\xa0 need\xa0to\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0regional\xa0and\xa0global\xa0production/value\xa0chain\xa0networks.\xa0\xa0Transaction\xa0costs\xa0for\xa0international\xa0 trade\xa0can\xa0be\xa0reduced\xa0through\xa0reforms\xa0of\xa0institutions,\xa0policies,\xa0and\xa0procedures,\xa0and\xa0through\xa0applying\xa0conflict\xa0 and\xa0gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 discourage\xa0the\xa0growth\xa0of\xa0overseas\xa0trade.\xa0A\xa0Diagnostic\xa0of\xa0Trade\xa0Integration\xa0Study\xa0(DTIS)\xa0will\xa0be\xa0carried\xa0out\xa0to\xa0 identify\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0improving\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0capacities\xa0to\xa0benefit\xa0from\xa0trade.\xa0Technical\xa0work\xa0following\xa0on\xa0 the\xa0DTIS\xa0could\xa0include\xa0additional\xa0knowledge\xa0work\xa0on\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0transport\xa0facilitation\xa0assessments,\xa0customs\xa0 modernization,\xa0 and\xa0 sector\xa0 specific\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0Development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 Toensurelong?termsustainabilityofpovertyreductionefforts,itwillbeimportantforMyanmartoadoptan integratedapproachtothemanagementofitsnaturalresourcesanddevelopanationallyagreedenvironmental andsocialsafeguardsframework.TheproposedWBGsupportinthisareawouldentail(i)programmatic analyticalworkthatwill(a)strengthenandsupportthequalityandstandardsofthenationalinstitutionaland regulatoryframeworkcapacityforenvironmentalandsocialassessment,implementationandmonitoringand evaluation,Publicparticipationandtransparencytointernationalstandardslevelthatwillpromotesustainable countrysystemstoaddressenvironmentalrisksofthecountrysinvestmentsprograms;and(b)assisttheGoM to manage environmental risks and challenges of natural resources (such as forests) and develop risk managementstrategybasedonanalysisofenvironmentalrisksfacingoneortwodevelopmentsectors;(ii) investmentstosustainablymanagetheAyeyarwaddyRiverBasin,tosupportcapacitybuildingofnational systemstocollectandanalyzedatatomakedecisionsaboutpossibleusesoftheAyeyarwaddyRiver,including onpossiblehydropowerdevelopment,transport,irrigationandfloodcontrol;and(iii)continuedsupportfor MyanmarsimplementationoftheExtractivesIndustriesTransparencyInitiativeaspartofresponsiblenatural resourcemanagement. . Givenitslongperiodofinternationalisolation,toseizeincreasedtradeandFDIopportunities,Myanmarwill needtobepartoftheregionalandglobalproduction/ValueChainnetworks.Transactioncostsforinternational tradecanbereducedthroughreformsofinstitutions,policies,andprocedures,andthroughapplyingconflict andgendersensitiveapproaches.Reformsareneededtoaddressnon?tariffmeasures(NTMs)andborder managementproceduresthatarebureaucraticandslowandthatraisethecostofdoingbusinessand discouragethegrowthofoverseastrade.ADiagnosticofTradeIntegrationStudy(DTIS)willbecarriedoutto identifyopportunitiesforimprovingMyanmarscapacitiestobenefitfromtrade.Technicalworkfollowingon theDTIScouldincludeadditionalknowledgeworkontradeandtransportfacilitationassessments,customs modernization, and sector specific technical assistance.These engagements would build on the WBG investmentclimateassessment,whichwillsupportapolicydialogueoncriticalbottlenecksfortheprivate sector.Advisoryservicesinkeysectors,includingagricultureandTourism,willenhanceMyanmarsabilityto benefitfromregionalintegrationandsupportdevelopmentinkeyValueChains. . 20.Reform?tradepolicy(number):31 Target:1(2017 Baseline:0(2014) Target:1(2017) 21.Numberofrecommended laws/regulations/amendments/codes enactedorgovernmentpolicies adopted Baseline:0(2014) Target:3(2017)

key\xa0constraint\xa0to\xa0the\xa0delivery\xa0of\xa0important\xa0services\xa0such\xa0as\xa0health,\xa0education\xa0and\xa0finance\xa0for\xa0rural\xa0populations\xa0 distribution\xa0and\xa0generation.\xa0\xa0Given\xa0the\xa0magnitude\xa0of\xa0the\xa0infrastructure\xa0gaps,\xa0this\xa0is\xa0a\xa0long?term\xa0engagement\xa0 that\xa0involves\xa0an\xa0umbrella\xa0approach\xa0with\xa0many\xa0partners\xa0(see\xa0para\xa078)\xa0under\xa0the\xa0coordination\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Myanmar\xa0 Power\xa0Sector\xa0Working\xa0Group,\xa0with\xa0the\xa0objective\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0 CPF\xa0period. 1. Power\xa0Sector\xa0Working\xa0Group,\xa0with\xa0the\xa0objective\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0 CPF\xa0period. 1. People\xa0 provided\xa0 with\xa0 new\xa0 or\xa0 improved\xa0electricity\xa0service\xa0(million)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n\xa0 \xa0 2.\xa0 Expanded\xa0 conventional/renewable\xa0 power\xa0 generation\xa0 (gigawatt\xa0 hours,\xa0 annual)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0260\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0660\xa0(2017)\xa0", "Improved\xa0access\xa0to\xa0critical\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0servicesfor\xa0the\xa0rural\xa0poor\xa0 . children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0power\xa0generation\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0electricity\xa0. Two?thirds\xa0of\xa0the\xa0population\xa0is\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0electricity\xa0grid\xa0and\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0reliable\xa0electricity\xa0is\xa0a\xa0 key\xa0constraint\xa0to\xa0the\xa0delivery\xa0of\xa0important\xa0services\xa0such\xa0as\xa0health,\xa0education\xa0and\xa0finance\xa0for\xa0rural\xa0populations\xa0 and\xa0for\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0development\xa0more\xa0broadly.\xa0The\xa0Government\xa0had\xa0developed\xa0a\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0 Plan\xa0to\xa0establish\xa0an\xa0enabling\xa0policy\xa0and\xa0institutional\xa0framework\xa0for\xa0a\xa0nationwide\xa0electrification\xa0program.\xa0The\xa0 proposed\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0Project\xa0is\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0help\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0electricity\xa0for\xa0populations\xa0 currently\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0grid.\xa0The\xa0ongoing\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0Project\xa0and\xa0proposed\xa0Myingyan\xa0Power\xa0 Generation\xa0Project\xa0are\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0increasing\xa0the\xa0capacity\xa0and\xa0efficiency\xa0of\xa0power\xa0generation\xa0in\xa0 Myanmar\xa0and\xa0strengthening\xa0the\xa0institutional\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Ministry\xa0of\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0and\xa0the\xa0Myanmar\xa0Electric\xa0 Power\xa0Enterprise.\xa0These\xa0activities\xa0will\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0WBG\x92s\xa0support\xa0to\xa0the\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0the\xa0National\xa0 Electrification\xa0Plan\xa0which\xa0also\xa0includes\xa0IFC\xa0advisory\xa0services\xa0and\xa0MIGA\xa0guarantees\xa0to\xa0support\xa0electricity\xa0 distribution\xa0and\xa0generation.\xa0\xa0Given\xa0the\xa0magnitude\xa0of\xa0the\xa0infrastructure\xa0gaps,\xa0this\xa0is\xa0a\xa0long?term\xa0engagement\xa0 that\xa0involves\xa0an\xa0umbrella\xa0approach\xa0with\xa0many\xa0partners\xa0(see\xa0para\xa078)\xa0under\xa0the\xa0coordination\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Myanmar\xa0 Power\xa0Sector\xa0Working\xa0Group,\xa0with\xa0the\xa0objective\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0 CPF\xa0period. 1. People\xa0 provided\xa0 with\xa0 new\xa0 or\xa0 improved\xa0electricity\xa0service\xa0(million)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n\xa0 \xa0 2.\xa0 Expanded\xa0 conventional/renewable\xa0 power\xa0 generation\xa0 (gigawatt\xa0 hours,\xa0 annual)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0260\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0660\xa0(2017)\xa0", "\xa0Increased\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0farming\xa0and\xa0agribusiness\xa0 \xa0 . Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 due\xa0to\xa0poor\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0compounded\xa0by\xa0an\xa0over?dependence\xa0on\xa0rice.\xa0Low\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0turn\xa0are\xa0a\xa0result\xa0of\xa0a\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0 access\xa0by\xa0farming\xa0households\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0agricultural\xa0assets,\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services.\xa0More\xa0productive\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 aims\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0order\xa0to\xa0have\xa0a\xa0positive\xa0effect\xa0on\xa0agricultural\xa0incomes.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0 Bank\xa0expects\xa0to\xa0support\xa0an\xa0integrated\xa0program\xa0that\xa0combines\xa0improvements\xa0in\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0drainage,\xa0 Given\xa0its\xa0long\xa0period\xa0of\xa0international\xa0isolation,\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0Myanmar\xa0will\xa0 need\xa0to\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0regional\xa0and\xa0global\xa0production/value\xa0chain\xa0networks.\xa0\xa0Transaction\xa0costs\xa0for\xa0international\xa0 trade\xa0can\xa0be\xa0reduced\xa0through\xa0reforms\xa0of\xa0institutions,\xa0policies,\xa0and\xa0procedures,\xa0and\xa0through\xa0applying\xa0conflict\xa0 and\xa0gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 discourage\xa0the\xa0growth\xa0of\xa0overseas\xa0trade.\xa0A\xa0Diagnostic\xa0of\xa0Trade\xa0Integration\xa0Study\xa0(DTIS)\xa0will\xa0be\xa0carried\xa0out\xa0to\xa0 identify\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0improving\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0capacities\xa0to\xa0benefit\xa0from\xa0trade.\xa0Technical\xa0work\xa0following\xa0on\xa0 the\xa0DTIS\xa0could\xa0include\xa0additional\xa0knowledge\xa0work\xa0on\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0transport\xa0facilitation\xa0assessments,\xa0customs\xa0 modernization,\xa0 and\xa0 sector\xa0 specific\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 children.para: Improvedaccesstocriticalinfrastructureandservicesfortheruralpoor . Ruralvillagesexperiencehighlevelsofpoverty,havelimitedaccesstoqualityservicesandinfrastructure,and havehadlittlevoiceinthedevelopmentprocess.Increasedinvestmentsincriticalinfrastructurethatcan improveaccesstomarketsandkeyservicescansignificantlyalterthedevelopmentpathbyempoweringrural communitiestoincreasetheirproductionandincome.TheWBGwillscaleupthenationalcommunity?driven developmentprogramtoincreaseaccesstobasicservicesforruralcommunities,includinginconflict?affected areas.Theprogramhelpsincreaseaccesstoanduseofbasicinfrastructureandservices(e.g.,smallfeederroads, foot?paths and bridges, drinking water systems, rehabilitation of Schools and Health centers) through a participatoryapproach,whilecreatingaplatformforgovernmenttodeliverinfrastructureimprovements throughabottomup,participatoryapproach.ThescaleupoftheCDDprojectisscheduledtorunthrough January2021,withindicatorsbelowreflectingonlytargetstobereachedduringtheCPFperiod.. Populationintownshipsbenefiting fromimprovedaccesstoanduseof ruralinfrastructureandservicesunder theWBGinterventions(number) Baseline:0.8million(2014) Target:3.3million(2017);ofwhichat least40percentfemale

Myanmar\xa0is\xa0a\xa0centralized\xa0country\xa0following\xa0decades\xa0of\xa0military\xa0rule,\xa0and\xa0fiscal\xa0and\xa0functional\xa0decentralization\xa0 is\xa0a\xa0core\xa0issue\xa0for\xa0more\xa0effective\xa0service\xa0delivery\xa0at\xa0the\xa0local\xa0level\xa0and\xa0for\xa0the\xa0current\xa0peace\xa0process.\xa0The\xa0 effectiveness\xa0and\xa0efficacy\xa0of\xa0the\xa0various\xa0pathways\xa0in\xa0ending\xa0poverty\xa0and\xa0boosting\xa0shared\xa0prosperity\xa0will\xa0 depend\xa0critically\xa0on\xa0the\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0Government\xa0to\xa0design\xa0and\xa0implement\xa0the\xa0right\xa0interventions,\xa0whether\xa0in\xa0 the\xa0form\xa0of\xa0policy,\xa0institutional\xa0reforms,\xa0or\xa0investments.\xa0WBG\xa0support\xa0for\xa0more\xa0effective\xa0public\xa0Institutions\xa0is\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0include\xa0the\xa0continued\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0an\xa0IDA\xa0operation\xa0that\xa0supports\xa0modernization\xa0of\xa0public\xa0financial\xa0management\xa0and\xa0provides\xa0technical\xa0assistance\xa0to\xa0address\xa0public\xa0 administration\xa0performance\xa0constraints\xa0in\xa0social\xa0and\xa0economic\xa0sectors. . 7.\xa0Formula\xa0for\xa0intergovernmental\xa0 transfers\xa0 Baseline:\xa0No\xa0formula\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0Approval\xa0of\xa0formula\xa0(2016)\xa0 \xa0 8.\xa0Budget\xa0preparation\xa0process\xa0in\xa0place,\xa0 including\xa0issuance\xa0of\xa0ceilings\xa0and\xa0 preparation\xa0of\xa0a\xa0medium?term\xa0fiscal\xa0 framework\xa0 Baseline:\xa0No\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0Yes\xa0(2017)\xa0", "Improved\xa0financial\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0finance\xa0. people.\xa0Only\xa030\xa0percent\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0adult\xa0population\xa0has\xa0access\xa0to\xa0financial\xa0services\xa0provided\xa0either\xa0by\xa0 commercial\xa0banks\xa0or\xa0microfinance\xa0Institutions.\xa0The\xa0WBG\xa0aims\xa0to\xa0support\xa0the\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0the\xa0country\x92s\xa0 Roadmap\xa0 for\xa0 Financial\xa0 "\xa0Improved\xa0capacity\xa0to\xa0facilitate\xa0(and\xa0benefit\xa0from)\xa0trade. Given\xa0its\xa0long\xa0period\xa0of\xa0international\xa0isolation,\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0Myanmar\xa0will\xa0 need\xa0to\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0regional\xa0and\xa0global\xa0production/value\xa0chain\xa0networks.\xa0\xa0Transaction\xa0costs\xa0for\xa0international\xa0 trade\xa0can\xa0be\xa0reduced\xa0through\xa0reforms\xa0of\xa0Institutions,\xa0policies,\xa0and\xa0procedures,\xa0and\xa0through\xa0applying\xa0conflict\xa0 and\xa0gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 identify\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0improving\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0capacities\xa0to\xa0benefit\xa0from\xa0trade.\xa0Technical\xa0work\xa0following\xa0on\xa0 the\xa0DTIS\xa0could\xa0include\xa0additional\xa0knowledge\xa0work\xa0on\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0transport\xa0facilitation\xa0assessments,\xa0customs\xa0 modernization,\xa0 and\xa0 sector\xa0 specific\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa01\xa0(2017\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa01\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 21.\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0recommended\xa0 laws/regulations/amendments/codes\xa0 enacted\xa0or\xa0government\xa0policies\xa0 adopted\xa0\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n", "\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0\xa0 . Access\xa0to\xa0telephone\xa0services\xa0was\xa0estimated\xa0at\xa020\xa0percent\xa0in\xa02014\xa0while\xa0internet\xa0penetration\xa0stood\xa0at\xa010\xa0 percent,\xa0the\xa0lowest\xa0rates\xa0in\xa0Southeast\xa0Asia.\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0will\xa0be\xa0critical\xa0for\xa0Myanmar\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0 increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0use\xa0technology\xa0for\xa0leapfrogging\xa0on\xa0issues\xa0such\xa0as\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0 finance,\xa0 and\xa0 support\xa0 a\xa0 vibrant\xa0 private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0The\xa0 WBG\xa0 will\xa0 continue\xa0 implementation\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 Telecommunications\xa0Sector\xa0Reform\xa0Project,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0regulatory\xa0reforms\xa0which\xa0will\xa0enable\xa0the\xa0 licensing\xa0of\xa0new\xa0private\xa0operators\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0foster\xa0competition\xa0leading\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0 prices,\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0and\xa0improved\xa0quality\xa0of\xa0services.\xa0The\xa0project\xa0will\xa0also\xa0build\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0public\xa0sector\xa0 Institutions,\xa0including\xa0in\xa0better\xa0spectrum\xa0management\xa0and\xa0developing\xa0e?government\xa0applications.\xa0\xa0Finally,\xa0it\xa0 will\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0the\xa0extension\xa0of\xa0basic\xa0telecommunications\xa0services\xa0into\xa0remote\xa0and\xa0poor\xa0rural\xa0communities\xa0 through\xa0a\xa0universal\xa0access\xa0program.\xa0\xa0\xa0 . 21.\xa0 Access\xa0 to\xa0 telephone\xa0 services\xa0 (fixed\xa0mainlines\xa0and\xa0cellular\xa0phones\xa0 per\xa0100\xa0people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa020\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa050\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 22.\xa0Access\xa0to\xa0Internet\xa0services\xa0 (number\xa0of\xa0subscribers\xa0per\xa0100\xa0 people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa010\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa015\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0\n" )

children.name: Infrastructure and Growth
children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0power\xa0generation\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0electricity\xa0. Two?thirds\xa0of\xa0the\xa0population\xa0is\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0electricity\xa0grid\xa0and\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0reliable\xa0electricity\xa0is\xa0a\xa0 key\xa0constraint\xa0to\xa0the\xa0delivery\xa0of\xa0important\xa0services\xa0such\xa0as\xa0health,\xa0education\xa0and\xa0finance\xa0for\xa0rural\xa0populations\xa0 and\xa0for\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0development\xa0more\xa0broadly.\xa0The\xa0Government\xa0had\xa0developed\xa0a\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0 Plan\xa0to\xa0establish\xa0an\xa0enabling\xa0policy\xa0and\xa0institutional\xa0framework\xa0for\xa0a\xa0nationwide\xa0electrification\xa0program.\xa0The\xa0 proposed\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0Project\xa0is\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0help\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0electricity\xa0for\xa0populations\xa0 currently\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0grid.\xa0The\xa0ongoing\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0Project\xa0and\xa0proposed\xa0Myingyan\xa0Power\xa0 Generation\xa0Project\xa0are\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0increasing\xa0the\xa0capacity\xa0and\xa0efficiency\xa0of\xa0power\xa0generation\xa0in\xa0 Myanmar\xa0and\xa0strengthening\xa0the\xa0institutional\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Ministry\xa0of\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0and\xa0the\xa0Myanmar\xa0Electric\xa0 Power\xa0Enterprise.\xa0These\xa0activities\xa0will\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0WBG\x92s\xa0support\xa0to\xa0the\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0the\xa0National\xa0 Electrification\xa0Plan\xa0which\xa0also\xa0includes\xa0IFC\xa0advisory\xa0services\xa0and\xa0MIGA\xa0guarantees\xa0to\xa0support\xa0electricity\xa0 distribution\xa0and\xa0generation.\xa0\xa0Given\xa0the\xa0magnitude\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Infrastructure\xa0gaps,\xa0this\xa0is\xa0a\xa0long?term\xa0engagement\xa0 that\xa0involves\xa0an\xa0umbrella\xa0approach\xa0with\xa0many\xa0partners\xa0(see\xa0para\xa078)\xa0under\xa0the\xa0coordination\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Myanmar\xa0 Power\xa0Sector\xa0Working\xa0Group,\xa0with\xa0the\xa0objective\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0 CPF\xa0period. 1. People\xa0 provided\xa0 with\xa0 new\xa0 or\xa0 improved\xa0electricity\xa0service\xa0(million)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n\xa0 \xa0 2.\xa0 Expanded\xa0 conventional/renewable\xa0 power\xa0 generation\xa0 (gigawatt\xa0 hours,\xa0 annual)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0260\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0660\xa0(2017)\xa0", "\xa0Increased\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0farming\xa0and\xa0agribusiness\xa0 \xa0 . Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 due\xa0to\xa0poor\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0compounded\xa0by\xa0an\xa0over?dependence\xa0on\xa0rice.\xa0Low\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0turn\xa0are\xa0a\xa0result\xa0of\xa0a\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0 access\xa0by\xa0farming\xa0households\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0agricultural\xa0assets,\xa0Infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services.\xa0More\xa0productive\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 aims\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0order\xa0to\xa0have\xa0a\xa0positive\xa0effect\xa0on\xa0agricultural\xa0incomes.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0 Bank\xa0expects\xa0to\xa0support\xa0an\xa0integrated\xa0program\xa0that\xa0combines\xa0improvements\xa0in\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0drainage,\xa0 extension\xa0services,\xa0and\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0upgrades\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0crop\xa0yields\xa0and\xa0develop\xa0a\xa0competitive\xa0rural\xa0sector\xa0that\xa0 offers\xa0opportunities\xa0to\xa0all\xa0rural\xa0households.\xa0\xa0Alongside\xa0analytical\xa0work,\xa0these\xa0initial\xa0engagements\xa0will\xa0pilot\xa0new\xa0 approaches,\xa0inform\xa0the\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0and\xa0serve\xa0a\xa0demonstration\xa0effect\xa0to\xa0facilitate\xa0reform\xa0across\xa0the\xa0sector.\xa0\xa0 The\xa0 World\xa0 Bank\xa0 will\xa0 also\xa0 support\xa0 further\xa0 agricultural\xa0 productivity\xa0 enhancements\xa0 by\xa0 providing\xa0 agrometeorological\xa0 services,\xa0 facilitating\xa0 inland\xa0 water\xa0 transport\xa0 for\xa0 agricultural\xa0 outputs\xa0 and\xa0 enhancing\xa0 the\xa0 government\x92s\xa0capacity\xa0to\xa0manage\xa0and\xa0deliver\xa0water\xa0resources\xa0to\xa0farmers. . 3.\xa0\xa0Average\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0targeted\xa0 irrigated\xa0areas\xa0 Baseline:\xa02.7\xa0tons/ha\xa0(wet\xa0season\xa0rice)\xa0 and\xa03.0\xa0tons/ha\xa0(dry\xa0season\xa0rice)\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa02.9\xa0tons/ha\xa0(wet\xa0season\xa0rice)\xa0 and\xa03.2\xa0tons/ha\xa0(dry\xa0season\xa0rice)\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 4.\xa0Cropping\xa0Intensity\xa0in\xa0targeted\xa0areas\xa0 (ratio)30\xa0 Baseline:\xa01.3\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa01.4\xa0(2017)\xa0\n", "Improved\xa0access\xa0to\xa0critical\xa0Infrastructure\xa0and\xa0servicesfor\xa0the\xa0rural\xa0poor\xa0 . currently\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0grid.\xa0The\xa0ongoing\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0Project\xa0and\xa0proposed\xa0Myingyan\xa0Power\xa0 children.para: Improvedfinancialinfrastructureandaccesstofinance. AccesstofinanceinMyanmarislimited,yetcriticaltopromoteinclusivenessofgrowthandempowermentof people.Only30percentofMyanmarsadultpopulationhasaccesstofinancialservicesprovidedeitherby commercialbanksormicrofinanceInstitutions.TheWBGaimstosupporttheimplementationofthecountrys Roadmap for Financial Inclusion by modernizing payment systems, Strengthening financial sector intermediaries,fosteringnewfinancialproducts,andBuildingcapacityoffinancialsectorregulatorsand supervisors.WBGinterventionsintheareaoffinancialinclusionwouldbestructuredinacomprehensive programthatisjointbetweenWB,IFCandinterestedbilateraldonorsaroundfourareas:(i)modernizing paymentsystemsandfinancialsectorinfrastructure,(ii)StrengtheningprivatefinancialInstitutionscriticalfor financialinclusion(microfinanceInstitutions,privatebanks)andtransformingselectState?ownedbanksinto financiallysustainableInstitutions,(iii)expandingfinancialinstrumentsandproducts(SMElending,agriculturelending,insurance,digitalfinance,etc.);and(iv)StrengtheningthecapabilityoftheCentralBankofMyanmar andMinistryofFinancetomonitorthesoundnessandintegrityofthefinancialsystem. . 16.Additionalpeople, microenterprisesandSMEs reachedwithfinancialservices Baseline:0(2014) Target(2017):200,000(2017) 17.Valueofadditional financingfacilitated(US$ million) Baseline:0(2014) Target:40(2017)

Toensurelong?termsustainabilityofPovertyreductionefforts,itwillbeimportantforMyanmartoadoptan integratedapproachtothemanagementofitsnaturalresourcesanddevelopanationallyagreedenvironmental andsocialsafeguardsframework.TheproposedWBGsupportinthisareawouldentail(i)programmatic analyticalworkthatwill(a)strengthenandsupportthequalityandstandardsofthenationalinstitutionaland regulatoryframeworkcapacityforenvironmentalandsocialassessment,implementationandmonitoringand evaluation,publicparticipationandtransparencytointernationalstandardslevelthatwillpromotesustainable countrysystemstoaddressenvironmentalrisksofthecountrysinvestmentsprograms;and(b)assisttheGoM to manage environmental risks and challenges of natural resources (such as forests) and develop risk managementstrategybasedonanalysisofenvironmentalrisksfacingoneortwodevelopmentsectors;(ii) investmentstosustainablymanagetheAyeyarwaddyRiverBasin,tosupportcapacitybuildingofnational systemstocollectandanalyzedatatomakeDecisionsaboutpossibleusesoftheAyeyarwaddyRiver,including onpossiblehydropowerdevelopment,transport,irrigationandfloodcontrol;and(iii)continuedsupportfor MyanmarsimplementationoftheExtractivesIndustriesTransparencyInitiativeaspartofresponsiblenatural resourcemanagement. . and\xa0gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 Access\xa0to\xa0telephone\xa0services\xa0was\xa0estimated\xa0at\xa020\xa0percent\xa0in\xa02014\xa0while\xa0internet\xa0penetration\xa0stood\xa0at\xa010\xa0 percent,\xa0the\xa0lowest\xa0rates\xa0in\xa0Southeast\xa0Asia.\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0will\xa0be\xa0critical\xa0for\xa0Myanmar\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0 increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0use\xa0technology\xa0for\xa0leapfrogging\xa0on\xa0issues\xa0such\xa0as\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0 Finance,\xa0 and\xa0 support\xa0 a\xa0 vibrant\xa0 private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0The\xa0 WBG\xa0 will\xa0 continue\xa0 implementation\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 Telecommunications\xa0Sector\xa0Reform\xa0Project,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0regulatory\xa0reforms\xa0which\xa0will\xa0enable\xa0the\xa0 licensing\xa0of\xa0new\xa0private\xa0operators\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0foster\xa0competition\xa0leading\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0 prices,\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0and\xa0improved\xa0quality\xa0of\xa0services.\xa0The\xa0project\xa0will\xa0also\xa0build\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0public\xa0sector\xa0 institutions,\xa0including\xa0in\xa0better\xa0spectrum\xa0management\xa0and\xa0developing\xa0e?government\xa0applications.\xa0\xa0Finally,\xa0it\xa0 will\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0the\xa0extension\xa0of\xa0basic\xa0telecommunications\xa0services\xa0into\xa0remote\xa0and\xa0poor\xa0rural\xa0communities\xa0 through\xa0a\xa0universal\xa0access\xa0program.\xa0\xa0\xa0 . 21.\xa0 Access\xa0 to\xa0 telephone\xa0 services\xa0 (fixed\xa0mainlines\xa0and\xa0cellular\xa0phones\xa0 per\xa0100\xa0people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa020\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa050\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 22.\xa0Access\xa0to\xa0Internet\xa0services\xa0 (number\xa0of\xa0subscribers\xa0per\xa0100\xa0 people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa010\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa015\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0\n", "\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0\xa0 . Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 due\xa0to\xa0poor\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0compounded\xa0by\xa0an\xa0over?dependence\xa0on\xa0rice.\xa0Low\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0turn\xa0are\xa0a\xa0result\xa0of\xa0a\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0 access\xa0by\xa0farming\xa0households\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0agricultural\xa0assets,\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services.\xa0More\xa0productive\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 aims\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0order\xa0to\xa0have\xa0a\xa0positive\xa0effect\xa0on\xa0agricultural\xa0incomes.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0 Bank\xa0expects\xa0to\xa0support\xa0an\xa0integrated\xa0program\xa0that\xa0combines\xa0improvements\xa0in\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0drainage,\xa0 offers\xa0opportunities\xa0to\xa0all\xa0rural\xa0households.\xa0\xa0Alongside\xa0analytical\xa0work,\xa0these\xa0initial\xa0engagements\xa0will\xa0pilot\xa0new\xa0 and\xa0for\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0development\xa0more\xa0broadly.\xa0The\xa0Government\xa0had\xa0developed\xa0a\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0 Plan\xa0to\xa0establish\xa0an\xa0enabling\xa0policy\xa0and\xa0institutional\xa0framework\xa0for\xa0a\xa0nationwide\xa0electrification\xa0program.\xa0The\xa0 proposed\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0Project\xa0is\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0help\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0electricity\xa0for\xa0populations\xa0 currently\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0grid.\xa0The\xa0ongoing\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0Project\xa0and\xa0proposed\xa0Myingyan\xa0Power\xa0 Generation\xa0Project\xa0are\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0increasing\xa0the\xa0capacity\xa0and\xa0efficiency\xa0of\xa0power\xa0generation\xa0in\xa0 Power\xa0Enterprise.\xa0These\xa0activities\xa0will\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0WBG\x92s\xa0support\xa0to\xa0the\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0the\xa0National\xa0 Electrification\xa0Plan\xa0which\xa0also\xa0includes\xa0IFC\xa0advisory\xa0services\xa0and\xa0MIGA\xa0guarantees\xa0to\xa0support\xa0electricity\xa0 distribution\xa0and\xa0generation.\xa0\xa0Given\xa0the\xa0magnitude\xa0of\xa0the\xa0infrastructure\xa0gaps,\xa0this\xa0is\xa0a\xa0long?term\xa0engagement\xa0 that\xa0involves\xa0an\xa0umbrella\xa0approach\xa0with\xa0many\xa0partners\xa0(see\xa0para\xa078)\xa0under\xa0the\xa0coordination\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Myanmar\xa0 Power\xa0Sector\xa0Working\xa0Group,\xa0with\xa0the\xa0objective\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0 CPF\xa0period. 1. People\xa0 provided\xa0 with\xa0 new\xa0 or\xa0 improved\xa0electricity\xa0service\xa0(million)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n\xa0 \xa0 2.\xa0 Expanded\xa0 conventional/renewable\xa0 power\xa0 generation\xa0 (gigawatt\xa0 hours,\xa0 annual)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0260\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0660\xa0(2017)\xa0", "\xa0Increased\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0farming\xa0and\xa0agribusiness\xa0 \xa0 . Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 due\xa0to\xa0poor\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0compounded\xa0by\xa0an\xa0over?dependence\xa0on\xa0rice.\xa0Low\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0turn\xa0are\xa0a\xa0result\xa0of\xa0a\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 proposed\xa0National\xa0Electrification\xa0Project\xa0is\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0help\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0electricity\xa0for\xa0populations\xa0 currently\xa0not\xa0connected\xa0to\xa0the\xa0national\xa0grid.\xa0The\xa0ongoing\xa0Electric\xa0Power\xa0Project\xa0and\xa0proposed\xa0Myingyan\xa0Power\xa0 distribution\xa0and\xa0generation.\xa0\xa0Given\xa0the\xa0magnitude\xa0of\xa0the\xa0infrastructure\xa0gaps,\xa0this\xa0is\xa0a\xa0long?term\xa0engagement\xa0 Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 children.name: Banking Institution Strengthening and Building
children.para: Improvedfinancialinfrastructureandaccesstofinance. AccesstofinanceinMyanmarislimited,yetcriticaltopromoteinclusivenessofgrowthandempowermentof people.Only30percentofMyanmarsadultpopulationhasaccesstofinancialservicesprovidedeitherby commercialbanksormicrofinanceInstitutions.TheWBGaimstosupporttheimplementationofthecountrys Roadmap for Financial Inclusion by modernizing payment systems, Strengthening financial sector intermediaries,fosteringnewfinancialproducts,andBuildingcapacityoffinancialsectorregulatorsand supervisors.WBGinterventionsintheareaoffinancialinclusionwouldbestructuredinacomprehensive programthatisjointbetweenWB,IFCandinterestedbilateraldonorsaroundfourareas:(i)modernizing paymentsystemsandfinancialsectorinfrastructure,(ii)StrengtheningprivatefinancialInstitutionscriticalfor financialinclusion(microfinanceInstitutions,privatebanks)andtransformingselectState?ownedbanksinto financiallysustainableInstitutions,(iii)expandingfinancialinstrumentsandproducts(SMElending,agriculturelending,insurance,digitalfinance,etc.);and(iv)StrengtheningthecapabilityoftheCentralBankofMyanmar andMinistryofFinancetomonitorthesoundnessandintegrityofthefinancialsystem. . 16.Additionalpeople, microenterprisesandSMEs reachedwithfinancialservices Baseline:0(2014) Target(2017):200,000(2017) 17.Valueofadditional financingfacilitated(US$ million) Baseline:0(2014) Target:40(2017)

children.name: e-Government
children.para: IncreasedaccesstoICT . Accesstotelephoneserviceswasestimatedat20percentin2014whileinternetpenetrationstoodat10 percent,thelowestratesinSoutheastAsia.IncreasedaccesstoICTwillbecriticalforMyanmartoseize increasedtradeandFDIopportunities,usetechnologyforleapfroggingonissuessuchasincreasedaccessto finance, and support a vibrant private sector.The WBG will continue implementation of the TelecommunicationsSectorReformProject,whichwillsupportregulatoryreformswhichwillenablethe licensingofnewprivateoperatorstolowerthecostofdoingbusinessandfostercompetitionleadingtolower prices,increasedaccessandimprovedqualityofservices.Theprojectwillalsobuildcapacityofpublicsector institutions,includinginbetterspectrummanagementanddevelopinge?governmentapplications.Finally,it willcontributetotheextensionofbasictelecommunicationsservicesintoremoteandpoorruralcommunities throughauniversalaccessprogram. . 21. Access to telephone services (fixedmainlinesandcellularphones per100people) Baseline:20(2014) Target:50(2017)  22.AccesstoInternetservices (numberofsubscribersper100 people) Baseline:10(2014) Target:15(2017)

children.para: Increasedunderstandingofpovertyandkeyrelatedissues. SignificantdataconstraintsinMyanmarlimitanunderstandingofpovertyandrelatedfactors,andcomplicate effortsattargetinginterventions,measuringimpact,andapplyingglobalexperienceinpolicydesignand implementation.TheWBGwillsupporttheGoMtoconductanationally?representativehouseholdsurveyto betterunderstanddimensionsofpovertyinMyanmarandallowtargetingofinterventionstowardsthepoor, includingabetterunderstandingofpovertyamongMyanmarsethnicminorities.TheWBGwillalsocontinueto supportthepreparationandimplementationofaNationalStrategyfortheDevelopmentofStatistics,tohelp Governmentmapandfillcriticalknowledgegaps.Theseengagementswillbecomplementedbyanalyticaland diagnosticworkonkeythematicissuesaswellasonreformsequencing,expectedtoincludetradeand agriculturalopportunities,landgovernance,socialinclusion,ethnicityandgender,migration,labormarkets, skillsdevelopmentandjobcreation,andaccesstofinanceinremoteareas.. 14.Nationalstatisticsstrategy endorsed Baseline:Nostrategy(2014) Target:Governmentendorsement (2015) 15.IncreaseGovernment knowledgeonpovertyandpublic Expenditures Baseline:limiteddata(2014) Target:Povertyassessmentand Expenditurereviewcompleted (2015)

children.name: Labor Diagnostics
children.para: Increasedunderstandingofpovertyandkeyrelatedissues. SignificantdataconstraintsinMyanmarlimitanunderstandingofpovertyandrelatedfactors,andcomplicate effortsattargetinginterventions,measuringimpact,andapplyingglobalexperienceinpolicydesignand implementation.TheWBGwillsupporttheGoMtoconductanationally?representativehouseholdsurveyto betterunderstanddimensionsofpovertyinMyanmarandallowtargetingofinterventionstowardsthepoor, includingabetterunderstandingofpovertyamongMyanmarsethnicminorities.TheWBGwillalsocontinueto supportthepreparationandimplementationofaNationalStrategyfortheDevelopmentofStatistics,tohelp Governmentmapandfillcriticalknowledgegaps.Theseengagementswillbecomplementedbyanalyticaland diagnosticworkonkeythematicissuesaswellasonreformsequencing,expectedtoincludetradeand agriculturalopportunities,landgovernance,socialinclusion,ethnicityandgender,migration,Labormarkets, skillsdevelopmentandjobcreation,andaccesstofinanceinremoteareas.. 14.Nationalstatisticsstrategy endorsed Baseline:Nostrategy(2014) Target:Governmentendorsement (2015) 15.Increasegovernment knowledgeonpovertyandpublic expenditures Baseline:limiteddata(2014) Target:Povertyassessmentand expenditurereviewcompleted (2015)

children.name: Livelihoods
children.para: Increasedproductivityinfarmingandagribusiness . HalfofMyanmarspoordependonagriculturefortheirLivelihoods,andagriculturalproductivityislow,mostly duetopoorriceyieldscompoundedbyanover?dependenceonrice.Lowyieldsinturnarearesultofalackof accessbyfarminghouseholdstoimprovedagriculturalassets,infrastructureandservices.Moreproductive agriculturewouldalsoencouragejobcreationthroughagro?processingandtradingactivities.TheWorldBank aimstoincreaseagriculturalproductivityinordertohaveapositiveeffectonagriculturalincomes.TheWorld Bankexpectstosupportanintegratedprogramthatcombinesimprovementsinirrigationanddrainage, extensionservices,andvaluechainupgradestoincreasecropyieldsanddevelopacompetitiveruralsectorthat offersopportunitiestoallruralhouseholds.Alongsideanalyticalwork,theseinitialengagementswillpilotnew approaches,informthepolicydialogueandserveademonstrationeffecttofacilitatereformacrossthesector. The World Bank will also support further agricultural productivity enhancements by providing agrometeorological services, facilitating inland water transport for agricultural outputs and enhancing the governmentscapacitytomanageanddeliverwaterresourcestofarmers. . 3.Averagericeyieldsintargeted irrigatedareas Baseline:2.7tons/ha(wetseasonrice) and3.0tons/ha(dryseasonrice)(2015) Target:2.9tons/ha(wetseasonrice) and3.2tons/ha(dryseasonrice)(2017) 4.CroppingIntensityintargetedareas (ratio)30 Baseline:1.3(2015) Target:1.4(2017)

SignificantdataconstraintsinMyanmarlimitanunderstandingofpovertyandrelatedfactors,andcomplicate effortsattargetinginterventions,measuringimpact,andapplyingglobalexperienceinpolicydesignand implementation.TheWBGwillsupporttheGoMtoconductanationally?representativehouseholdsurveyto betterunderstanddimensionsofpovertyinMyanmarandallowtargetingofinterventionstowardsthepoor, includingabetterunderstandingofpovertyamongMyanmarsethnicminorities.TheWBGwillalsocontinueto supportthepreparationandimplementationofaNationalStrategyfortheDevelopmentofStatistics,tohelp Governmentmapandfillcriticalknowledgegaps.Theseengagementswillbecomplementedbyanalyticaland diagnosticworkonkeythematicIssuesaswellasonreformsequencing,expectedtoincludetradeand agriculturalopportunities,landgovernance,socialinclusion,ethnicityandgender,migration,laborMarkets, skillsdevelopmentandjobcreation,andAccesstofinanceinremoteareas.. 14.Nationalstatisticsstrategy endorsed Baseline:Nostrategy(2014) Target:Governmentendorsement (2015) 15.Increasegovernment knowledgeonpovertyandpublic expenditures Baseline:limiteddata(2014) Target:Povertyassessmentand expenditurereviewcompleted (2015)

Significant\xa0data\xa0constraints\xa0in\xa0Myanmar\xa0limit\xa0an\xa0understanding\xa0of\xa0poverty\xa0and\xa0related\xa0factors,\xa0and\xa0complicate\xa0 efforts\xa0at\xa0targeting\xa0interventions,\xa0measuring\xa0impact,\xa0and\xa0applying\xa0global\xa0experience\xa0in\xa0policy\xa0design\xa0and\xa0 implementation.\xa0\xa0The\xa0WBG\xa0will\xa0support\xa0the\xa0GoM\xa0to\xa0conduct\xa0a\xa0nationally?representative\xa0household\xa0survey\xa0to\xa0 better\xa0understand\xa0dimensions\xa0of\xa0poverty\xa0in\xa0Myanmar\xa0and\xa0allow\xa0targeting\xa0of\xa0interventions\xa0towards\xa0the\xa0poor,\xa0 including\xa0a\xa0better\xa0understanding\xa0of\xa0poverty\xa0among\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ethnic\xa0minorities.\xa0The\xa0WBG\xa0will\xa0also\xa0continue\xa0to\xa0 support\xa0the\xa0preparation\xa0and\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0a\xa0National\xa0Strategy\xa0for\xa0the\xa0Development\xa0of\xa0Statistics,\xa0to\xa0help\xa0 Government\xa0map\xa0and\xa0fill\xa0critical\xa0knowledge\xa0gaps.\xa0\xa0These\xa0engagements\xa0will\xa0be\xa0complemented\xa0by\xa0analytical\xa0and\xa0 diagnostic\xa0work\xa0on\xa0key\xa0thematic\xa0issues\xa0as\xa0well\xa0as\xa0on\xa0reform\xa0sequencing,\xa0expected\xa0to\xa0include\xa0Trade\xa0and\xa0 agricultural\xa0opportunities,\xa0land\xa0governance,\xa0social\xa0inclusion,\xa0ethnicity\xa0and\xa0gender,\xa0migration,\xa0labor\xa0markets,\xa0 skills\xa0development\xa0and\xa0job\xa0creation,\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0finance\xa0in\xa0remote\xa0areas.. 14.\xa0National\xa0statistics\xa0strategy\xa0 endorsed\xa0 Baseline:\xa0No\xa0strategy\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa0Government\xa0endorsement\xa0 (2015)\xa0 \xa0 15.\xa0Increase\xa0government\xa0 knowledge\xa0on\xa0poverty\xa0and\xa0public\xa0 expenditures\xa0 Baseline:\xa0limited\xa0data\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0Poverty\xa0assessment\xa0and\xa0 expenditure\xa0review\xa0completed\xa0 (2015)\xa0", "\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0\xa0 . Access\xa0to\xa0telephone\xa0services\xa0was\xa0estimated\xa0at\xa020\xa0percent\xa0in\xa02014\xa0while\xa0internet\xa0penetration\xa0stood\xa0at\xa010\xa0 percent,\xa0the\xa0lowest\xa0rates\xa0in\xa0Southeast\xa0Asia.\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0will\xa0be\xa0critical\xa0for\xa0Myanmar\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0 increased\xa0Trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0use\xa0technology\xa0for\xa0leapfrogging\xa0on\xa0issues\xa0such\xa0as\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0 finance,\xa0 and\xa0 support\xa0 a\xa0 vibrant\xa0 private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0The\xa0 WBG\xa0 will\xa0 continue\xa0 implementation\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 Telecommunications\xa0Sector\xa0Reform\xa0Project,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0regulatory\xa0reforms\xa0which\xa0will\xa0enable\xa0the\xa0 licensing\xa0of\xa0new\xa0private\xa0operators\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0foster\xa0competition\xa0leading\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0 prices,\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0and\xa0improved\xa0quality\xa0of\xa0services.\xa0The\xa0project\xa0will\xa0also\xa0build\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0public\xa0sector\xa0 institutions,\xa0including\xa0in\xa0better\xa0spectrum\xa0management\xa0and\xa0developing\xa0e?government\xa0applications.\xa0\xa0Finally,\xa0it\xa0 will\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0the\xa0extension\xa0of\xa0basic\xa0telecommunications\xa0services\xa0into\xa0remote\xa0and\xa0poor\xa0rural\xa0communities\xa0 through\xa0a\xa0universal\xa0access\xa0program.\xa0\xa0\xa0 . 21.\xa0 Access\xa0 to\xa0 telephone\xa0 services\xa0 (fixed\xa0mainlines\xa0and\xa0cellular\xa0phones\xa0 per\xa0100\xa0people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa020\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa050\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 22.\xa0Access\xa0to\xa0Internet\xa0services\xa0 (number\xa0of\xa0subscribers\xa0per\xa0100\xa0 people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa010\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa015\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0\n" )

Access\xa0to\xa0telephone\xa0services\xa0was\xa0estimated\xa0at\xa020\xa0percent\xa0in\xa02014\xa0while\xa0internet\xa0penetration\xa0stood\xa0at\xa010\xa0 percent,\xa0the\xa0lowest\xa0rates\xa0in\xa0Southeast\xa0Asia.\xa0Increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0ICT\xa0will\xa0be\xa0critical\xa0for\xa0Myanmar\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0 increased\xa0Trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0use\xa0technology\xa0for\xa0leapfrogging\xa0on\xa0issues\xa0such\xa0as\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0to\xa0 finance,\xa0 and\xa0 support\xa0 a\xa0 vibrant\xa0 private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0The\xa0 WBG\xa0 will\xa0 continue\xa0 implementation\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 Telecommunications\xa0Sector\xa0Reform\xa0Project,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0regulatory\xa0reforms\xa0which\xa0will\xa0enable\xa0the\xa0 licensing\xa0of\xa0new\xa0private\xa0operators\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0foster\xa0competition\xa0leading\xa0to\xa0lower\xa0 prices,\xa0increased\xa0access\xa0and\xa0improved\xa0quality\xa0of\xa0services.\xa0The\xa0project\xa0will\xa0also\xa0build\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0public\xa0sector\xa0 institutions,\xa0including\xa0in\xa0better\xa0spectrum\xa0management\xa0and\xa0developing\xa0e?government\xa0applications.\xa0\xa0Finally,\xa0it\xa0 will\xa0contribute\xa0to\xa0the\xa0extension\xa0of\xa0basic\xa0telecommunications\xa0services\xa0into\xa0remote\xa0and\xa0poor\xa0rural\xa0communities\xa0 through\xa0a\xa0universal\xa0access\xa0program.\xa0\xa0\xa0 . 21.\xa0 Access\xa0 to\xa0 telephone\xa0 services\xa0 (fixed\xa0mainlines\xa0and\xa0cellular\xa0phones\xa0 per\xa0100\xa0people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa020\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa050\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 22.\xa0Access\xa0to\xa0Internet\xa0services\xa0 (number\xa0of\xa0subscribers\xa0per\xa0100\xa0 people)\xa0 Baseline:\xa010\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa015\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0\n" )

Rural\xa0villages\xa0experience\xa0high\xa0levels\xa0of\xa0poverty,\xa0have\xa0limited\xa0access\xa0to\xa0quality\xa0services\xa0and\xa0infrastructure,\xa0and\xa0 have\xa0had\xa0little\xa0voice\xa0in\xa0the\xa0Development\xa0process.\xa0Increased\xa0investments\xa0in\xa0critical\xa0infrastructure\xa0that\xa0can\xa0 improve\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets\xa0and\xa0key\xa0services\xa0can\xa0significantly\xa0alter\xa0the\xa0Development\xa0path\xa0by\xa0empowering\xa0rural\xa0 communities\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0their\xa0production\xa0and\xa0income.\xa0\xa0The\xa0WBG\xa0will\xa0scale\xa0up\xa0the\xa0national\xa0community?driven\xa0 Development\xa0program\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0basic\xa0services\xa0for\xa0rural\xa0communities,\xa0including\xa0in\xa0conflict?affected\xa0 areas.\xa0The\xa0program\xa0helps\xa0increase\xa0access\xa0to\xa0and\xa0use\xa0of\xa0basic\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services\xa0(e.g.,\xa0small\xa0feeder\xa0roads,\xa0 foot?paths\xa0 and\xa0 bridges,\xa0 drinking\xa0 water\xa0 systems,\xa0 rehabilitation\xa0 of\xa0 schools\xa0 and\xa0 health\xa0 centers)\xa0 through\xa0 a\xa0 participatory\xa0approach,\xa0while\xa0creating\xa0a\xa0platform\xa0for\xa0government\xa0to\xa0deliver\xa0infrastructure\xa0improvements\xa0 through\xa0a\xa0bottom\xa0up,\xa0participatory\xa0approach.\xa0\xa0The\xa0scale\xa0up\xa0of\xa0the\xa0CDD\xa0project\xa0is\xa0scheduled\xa0to\xa0run\xa0through\xa0 January\xa02021,\xa0with\xa0indicators\xa0below\xa0reflecting\xa0only\xa0targets\xa0to\xa0be\xa0reached\xa0during\xa0the\xa0CPF\xa0period.\xa0\xa0. children.name: Road Rehabilitation
children.para: Improvedaccesstocriticalinfrastructureandservicesfortheruralpoor . Ruralvillagesexperiencehighlevelsofpoverty,havelimitedaccesstoqualityservicesandinfrastructure,and havehadlittlevoiceinthedevelopmentprocess.Increasedinvestmentsincriticalinfrastructurethatcan improveaccesstomarketsandkeyservicescansignificantlyalterthedevelopmentpathbyempoweringrural communitiestoincreasetheirproductionandincome.TheWBGwillscaleupthenationalcommunity?driven developmentprogramtoincreaseaccesstobasicservicesforruralcommunities,includinginconflict?affected areas.Theprogramhelpsincreaseaccesstoanduseofbasicinfrastructureandservices(e.g.,smallfeederRoads, foot?paths and bridges, drinking water systems, Rehabilitation of schools and health centers) through a participatoryapproach,whilecreatingaplatformforgovernmenttodeliverinfrastructureimprovements throughabottomup,participatoryapproach.ThescaleupoftheCDDprojectisscheduledtorunthrough January2021,withindicatorsbelowreflectingonlytargetstobereachedduringtheCPFperiod.. Populationintownshipsbenefiting fromimprovedaccesstoanduseof ruralinfrastructureandservicesunder theWBGinterventions(number) Baseline:0.8million(2014) Target:3.3million(2017);ofwhichat least40percentfemale

Half\xa0of\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0poor\xa0depend\xa0on\xa0agriculture\xa0for\xa0their\xa0livelihoods,\xa0and\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0is\xa0low,\xa0mostly\xa0 due\xa0to\xa0poor\xa0rice\xa0yields\xa0compounded\xa0by\xa0an\xa0over?dependence\xa0on\xa0rice.\xa0Low\xa0yields\xa0in\xa0turn\xa0are\xa0a\xa0result\xa0of\xa0a\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0 access\xa0by\xa0farming\xa0households\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0agricultural\xa0assets,\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services.\xa0More\xa0productive\xa0 agriculture\xa0would\xa0also\xa0encourage\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0through\xa0agro?processing\xa0and\xa0trading\xa0activities.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0Bank\xa0 aims\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0in\xa0order\xa0to\xa0have\xa0a\xa0positive\xa0effect\xa0on\xa0agricultural\xa0incomes.\xa0The\xa0World\xa0 Bank\xa0expects\xa0to\xa0support\xa0an\xa0integrated\xa0program\xa0that\xa0combines\xa0improvements\xa0in\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0drainage,\xa0 extension\xa0services,\xa0and\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0upgrades\xa0to\xa0increase\xa0crop\xa0yields\xa0and\xa0develop\xa0a\xa0competitive\xa0rural\xa0sector\xa0that\xa0 offers\xa0opportunities\xa0to\xa0all\xa0rural\xa0households.\xa0\xa0Alongside\xa0analytical\xa0work,\xa0these\xa0initial\xa0engagements\xa0will\xa0pilot\xa0new\xa0 approaches,\xa0inform\xa0the\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0and\xa0serve\xa0a\xa0demonstration\xa0effect\xa0to\xa0facilitate\xa0reform\xa0across\xa0the\xa0sector.\xa0\xa0 The\xa0 World\xa0 Bank\xa0 will\xa0 also\xa0 support\xa0 further\xa0 agricultural\xa0 productivity\xa0 enhancements\xa0 by\xa0 providing\xa0 agrometeorological\xa0 services,\xa0 facilitating\xa0 inland\xa0 water\xa0 Transport\xa0 Myanmar\x92s\xa0implementation\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Extractives\xa0Industries\xa0Transparency\xa0Initiative\xa0as\xa0part\xa0of\xa0responsible\xa0natural\xa0 resource\xa0management.\xa0\xa0 . \xa0Country\xa0demonstrates\xa0capacity\xa0for\xa0 sustainable\xa0environmental\xa0and\xa0natural\xa0 resource\xa0management\xa0by\xa0preparing\xa0and\xa0 implementing\xa0investment\xa0projects\xa0 following\xa0quality\xa0safeguards\xa0and\xa0 performance\xa0standards\xa0(number\xa0of\xa0 projects)\xa0\xa0 Baseline:\xa04\xa0(2014)\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa08\xa0(2017)\xa0\xa0", "\xa0Improved\xa0capacity\xa0to\xa0facilitate\xa0(and\xa0benefit\xa0from)\xa0trade. Given\xa0its\xa0long\xa0period\xa0of\xa0international\xa0isolation,\xa0to\xa0seize\xa0increased\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0FDI\xa0opportunities,\xa0Myanmar\xa0will\xa0 need\xa0to\xa0be\xa0part\xa0of\xa0the\xa0regional\xa0and\xa0global\xa0production/value\xa0chain\xa0networks.\xa0\xa0Transaction\xa0costs\xa0for\xa0international\xa0 trade\xa0can\xa0be\xa0reduced\xa0through\xa0reforms\xa0of\xa0institutions,\xa0policies,\xa0and\xa0procedures,\xa0and\xa0through\xa0applying\xa0conflict\xa0 and\xa0gender\xa0sensitive\xa0approaches.\xa0Reforms\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0address\xa0non?tariff\xa0measures\xa0(NTMs)\xa0and\xa0border\xa0 management\xa0procedures\xa0that\xa0are\xa0bureaucratic\xa0and\xa0slow\xa0and\xa0that\xa0raise\xa0the\xa0cost\xa0of\xa0doing\xa0business\xa0and\xa0 discourage\xa0the\xa0growth\xa0of\xa0overseas\xa0trade.\xa0A\xa0Diagnostic\xa0of\xa0Trade\xa0Integration\xa0Study\xa0(DTIS)\xa0will\xa0be\xa0carried\xa0out\xa0to\xa0 identify\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0improving\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0capacities\xa0to\xa0benefit\xa0from\xa0trade.\xa0Technical\xa0work\xa0following\xa0on\xa0 the\xa0DTIS\xa0could\xa0include\xa0additional\xa0knowledge\xa0work\xa0on\xa0trade\xa0and\xa0Transport\xa0facilitation\xa0assessments,\xa0customs\xa0 modernization,\xa0 and\xa0 sector\xa0 specific\xa0 technical\xa0 assistance.\xa0\xa0These\xa0 engagements\xa0 would\xa0 build\xa0 on\xa0 the\xa0 WBG\xa0 investment\xa0climate\xa0assessment,\xa0which\xa0will\xa0support\xa0a\xa0policy\xa0dialogue\xa0on\xa0critical\xa0bottlenecks\xa0for\xa0the\xa0private\xa0 sector.\xa0\xa0Advisory\xa0services\xa0in\xa0key\xa0sectors,\xa0including\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0tourism,\xa0will\xa0enhance\xa0Myanmar\x92s\xa0ability\xa0to\xa0 benefit\xa0from\xa0regional\xa0integration\xa0and\xa0support\xa0development\xa0in\xa0key\xa0value\xa0chains.\xa0\n. 20.\xa0Reform\xa0?\xa0trade\xa0policy\xa0(number):31\xa0\xa0 Target:\xa01\xa0(2017\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa01\xa0(2017)\xa0 \xa0 21.\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0recommended\xa0 laws/regulations/amendments/codes\xa0 enacted\xa0or\xa0government\xa0policies\xa0 adopted\xa0\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa03\xa0(2017)\xa0\n" )

children.name: Irrigation and Drainage
Drainage
children.para: Increasedproductivityinfarmingandagribusiness . HalfofMyanmarspoordependonagriculturefortheirlivelihoods,andagriculturalproductivityislow,mostly duetopoorriceyieldscompoundedbyanover?dependenceonrice.Lowyieldsinturnarearesultofalackof accessbyfarminghouseholdstoimprovedagriculturalassets,infrastructureandservices.Moreproductive agriculturewouldalsoencouragejobcreationthroughagro?processingandtradingactivities.TheWorldBank aimstoincreaseagriculturalproductivityinordertohaveapositiveeffectonagriculturalincomes.TheWorld BankexpectstosupportanintegratedprogramthatcombinesimprovementsinirrigationandDrainage, extensionservices,andvaluechainupgradestoincreasecropyieldsanddevelopacompetitiveruralsectorthat offersopportunitiestoallruralhouseholds.Alongsideanalyticalwork,theseinitialengagementswillpilotnew approaches,informthepolicydialogueandserveademonstrationeffecttofacilitatereformacrossthesector. The World Bank will also support further agricultural productivity enhancements by providing agrometeorological services, facilitating inland water transport for agricultural outputs and enhancing the governmentscapacitytomanageanddeliverwaterresourcestofarmers. . 3.Averagericeyieldsintargeted irrigatedareas Baseline:2.7tons/ha(wetseasonrice) and3.0tons/ha(dryseasonrice)(2015) Target:2.9tons/ha(wetseasonrice) and3.2tons/ha(dryseasonrice)(2017) 4.CroppingIntensityintargetedareas (ratio)30 Baseline:1.3(2015) Target:1.4(2017)
